intro: Amoora salomoniensis, commonly known as the Solomon Islands hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces fibrous, woody stems that can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
